definition: to separate somebody/something physically or socially from other people or things
to separate a part of a situation, problem, idea, etc. so that you can see what it is and deal with it separately
to separate a single substance, cell, etc. from others so that you can study it
to protect something with a material that prevents heat, sound, electricity, etc. from passing through
to protect somebody/something from unpleasant experiences or influences
to form into a mass or group; to collect things and form them into a mass or group
part of a seat that supports somebody’s back
meat from the back or sides of a pig that has been cured (= preserved using salt or smoke), usually served in thin slices
to be successful at something; to earn money for your family to live on
to rescue somebody from a very difficult situation
a building or place that has been made stronger and protected against attack
a bad or evil character in a film, book, play, etc.
using a logical method of thinking about something in order to understand it, especially by looking at all the parts separately
using scientific analysis in order to find out about something
using a logical method of thinking about something in order to understand it, especially by looking at all the parts separately
using scientific analysis in order to find out about something
using word order rather than word endings to show the functions of words in a sentence
thin so that the bones can be seen clearly under the skin
having angles or sharp corners
the measurement from one side of something to the other; how wide something is
a piece of material of a particular width
the distance between the two long sides of a swimming pool
the distance or measurement from one side to the other; how broad or wide something is
a wide range (of knowledge, interests, etc.)
in or to all parts of a place
often angry; in an angry mood
connected with the natural conditions in which people, animals and plants live; connected with the environment
connected with the conditions that affect the behaviour and development of somebody/something
meat from the back leg or side of a pig that has been cured (= preserved using salt or smoke), usually served in thick slices
a short performance given by an actor, a singer, etc., so that somebody can decide whether they are suitable to act in a play, sing in a concert, etc.
starting to lose the hair on your head
to be in charge of somebody/something and make sure that everything is done correctly, safely, etc.
something that makes you think about or remember somebody/something, that you have forgotten or would like to forget
a letter or note informing somebody that they have not done something
all the people who live in a particular area, country, etc. when talked about as a group
a group of people who share the same religion, race, job, etc.
the feeling of sharing things and belonging to a group in the place where you live
a group of people who live together and all equally own and share what they have
a group of plants and animals growing or living in the same place or environment
a piece of music for one or more solo instruments playing with an orchestra
to show a lack of respect for somebody, especially by saying offensive things to them
to become worse, for example by becoming lower in quality or weaker
a short piece of clothing with buttons down the front but no arms, usually worn over a shirt and under a jacket, often forming part of a formal suit
any of the long, stiff hairs that grow near the mouth of a cat, mouse, etc.
the hair growing on a man’s face, especially on the sides of his face
to be the best thing, person, idea, etc.
to almost do something
by a very small amount
a large amount of a light material pressed tightly together and tied up
a song or poem that tells a story
a slow song about love
connected with ballistics
to become very angry
connected with the amount or number of something rather than with how good it is
light or a place that light comes from
bright coloured lights used to decorate a town or building for a special occasion
a coloured decoration, usually painted by hand, in an old book
understanding or explanation of something
the performance of something, especially a song or piece of music; the particular way in which it is performed
(especially in the US) the practice of sending foreign suspects to be questioned in another country where the laws about the treatment of prisoners are less strict
a factory in which wood is cut into boards using machines
a large round yellow citrus fruit with juice that has a slightly sharp bitter taste
a person who travels in a balloon as a sport
a religious song of praise to God or a god, especially one sung by Christians in church
if a film, book, etc. is a hymn to something, it praises it very strongly
to show that you are in agreement with each other by saying the same things in public
a very large room used for dancing on formal occasions
a substance produced in the body when you are excited, afraid or angry. It makes the heart beat faster and increases your energy and ability to move quickly.
